FwkSenCnt.MEANING: the head waiter in a restaurant or hotel

ExCnt.EX: The maître d ' looked at her , and his top lip drew back in a grimace .

The hotels can always be relied upon to be first-class , their maitre d's d's always remembering your name , their waiters mastering the art of attentive yet discreet service and their concierges always going that extra mile to ensure that your stay is as pampered as possible .
If , like me , you are intimidated by mere maître d's , then you may find the prospect of the close attentions of someone called a Villa Master somewhat traumatising .
For those with ability it is possible to rise through the ranks to senior maître d'hôtel .
What it is not is the old-fashioned European-style service , with tuxedoed captains , imposing maitres d'hotel , rigid rules of service , and an air of hauteur and intimidation .
